item.title: D.A. add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "To see a World in a Grain of Sand And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand And Eternity in an hour." -- William Blake

item.title: D.A. add a quote by D.A. Powell
item.description: "Death is not ambiguous." -- D.A. Powell

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Diana Ross
item.description: "Don't call the doctor, don't call ya mamma, don't call the preacher; no, I don't need it." -- Diana Ross

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "All that we don’t know is astonishing. Even more astonishing is what passes for knowing." -- Philip Roth

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Nothing is more real than nothing." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "Life was a funny thing that happened to me on the way to the grave." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are gone, either write things worth reading or do things worth writing." -- Carson McCullers

item.title: D.A. add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "People can cry much easier than they can change." -- James Baldwin

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: D.A. add a quote by J.L. Carr
item.description: "I’m an apple expert. Apples are the only exam I could ever hope to pass." -- J.L. Carr

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Lan Samantha Chang
item.description: "The people who matter the most to us in the end, who teach us the most, are the people who make their worst mistakes with us." -- Lan Samantha Chang

item.title: D.A. add a quote by C. D. Wright
item.description: "Readers have to be sought out and won to the light of the page, poem by poem, one by one by one." -- C. D. Wright

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Virgil
item.description: "Trust one who has gone through it." -- Virgil

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. There's your answer." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "It takes a heap of loafing to write a book." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Grandmaster Flash
item.description: "Athletes rejected, governors corrected Gangsters, thugs and smugglers are thoroughly respected The money gets divided The women get excited Now I'm broke and it's no joke It's hard as hell to fight it, don't buy it! " -- Grandmaster Flash

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Novalis
item.description: "Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason." -- Novalis

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Christopher Isherwood
item.description: "You see, Kenny, there are some things you don't even know you know, until you're asked." -- Christopher Isherwood

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "For small erections may be finished by their first architects; grand ones, true ones, ever leave the copestone to posterity. God keep me from ever completing anything. This whole book is but a draught—nay, but the draught of a draught. Oh, Time, Strength, Cash, and Patience!" -- Herman Melville

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "Art hurts. Art urges voyages - and it is easier to stay at home." -- Gwendolyn Brooks

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "I wish I’d a knowed more people. I would of loved ‘em all. If I’d a knowed more, I would a loved more" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "The world, even the smallest parts of it, is filled with things you don't know." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "It is very, very easy not to be offended by a book. You just have to shut it." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: D.A. add a quote by John Dos Passos
item.description: "I never see the dawn that I don't say to myself perhaps." -- John Dos Passos

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Grace has a grand laughter in it." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: D.A. add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do." -- Voltaire
